content: this is team G and we're making a half or a fireplace
all right so fireplace or half and so remember a few videos ago I said not to
throw away those curved rock pieces well this is why so grab those and a 5x5
square of cardboard so five by five centimeters that it's not five by five
inches that would be extremely huge and cut it measure at two and a centimeters
to the middle on both sides and then cut down with a craft knife then run a line
of hot glue down each side of the arc and also on the side of the cardboard
there which I didn't do so I'm redoing there naughty me and stick that those
two wrecked ends of cardboard to that and then run some hot glue across the
top and place the other arc on top of it so he have a fire a fireplace of sort so
to cover up the corrugation I'm just using masking tape which I think I got
this for about a dollar and it's 25 meters so it's not super expensive you
can just use cardstock or paper or whatever and run over the edges I just
find this is quicker and easier masking tape sometimes you have to be careful if
does not adhere super well because it's meant to be taken off once you've
painted and things like that because it's really I need to mask an area hence
masking tape and so make sure you've pressed it down well so if because if
any paint or anything gets underneath it it may just peel off but I found if you
press it down well you shouldn't have any problems
then you grab a drinking straw and just cut my various lengths I'm not measuring
as you can see you're just cutting various lengths and I've grabbed a
matchstick or two matchsticks and cut them in half and then we're just
applying hot glue and putting the drinking a sprawl bits down onto the
sort of back into the fireplace and hot glue around that that will form the ash
as well so you can pull it out a little bit to you know give some texture to the
base now the beauty of this is once we've added all these in the matchsticks
and everything form the logs that are in the fireplace and there's enough space
for you to add extra bits and things inside as well if you wish maybe it's
more cauldron or pot or something and now onto the chimney so the chimney is
basically a toilet paper all a cut out a piece just so that it's not too round
and then cut out a smaller piece which is probably around four centimeters high
and probably five centimeters in circumference and you can see there's
hot glue the two edges together there hold it to the Cure's and then apply hot
glue to the top and then more hot glue to the top of that and apply cardstock
to the top there now you can have traced that out if you wish with it with a
pencil and then cut it out and then stick it on but if I just do it this way
it's a little bit quicker now the top of the fireplace there is big enough to
have minis on it so you can have actually people jumping up onto the
mantelpiece and you can stand miniatures and things on top of that and if you
want someone in the chimney you can stand them on that as well there's a
form of base and there we go that's what it will be like in the corner of a room
so this could be a tavern or something to that effect or a kitchen inside the
dungeon so then our black monitors in video three and I'm editing it with
white and then once all the edges are down I am applying yellow paint leaving
some black areas available on the wood so there'll be no Brown for the wood
it'll all just be black and I start with whites on the wood and then white on the
red on the edging for the outer glow and there's a glow in the back as you can
see there as well so I use red yellow and white and a mixture of those that
them together super well so that you have the different colors kind of coming
through and that is pretty much it so that's how I make a fireplace / half of
